result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary S Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Agent may petition for early termination after 2 yrs.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary S Meyer

defendant.name: Meyer, Zachary S

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defn was not eligible for drug court (out-of-county resident); To be set for plea & sentencing (allowing time for treatment)
Final pre-trial on July 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:32
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.
Def does not qualify for Drug Court; doesn't live in the county.

Defendant in court with Attorney Debra A Stroik.  Timothy J Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on June 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall not discuss the facts of the case with Crystal B.
  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 7

Defendant appeared.  Chelsea Wetzjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
